Premier League.Arsenal: Arsenal went unbeaten in the 2003–04 Premier League season.
Premier League.Aston Villa: Aston Villa were one of the founding members of the Football League in 1888.
Premier League.Bournemouth: AFC Bournemouth's nickname is 'The Cherries' due to their red and black kit.
Premier League.Brentford: Brentford moved to their new home, the Brentford Community Stadium, in 2020.
Premier League.Brighton: Brighton's home ground is the American Express Community Stadium, known as the Amex.
Premier League.Chelsea: Chelsea won the UEFA Champions League in 2012 and 2021.
Premier League.Crystal Palace: Crystal Palace's mascot is an eagle named Kayla.
Premier League.Everton: Everton have played more seasons in the top flight than any other English club.
Premier League.Fulham: Fulham is London's oldest professional football club, founded in 1879.
Premier League.Ipswich: Ipswich Town won the English league title in their first season in the top division in 1961–62.
Premier League.Leicester: Leicester City won their first Premier League title in the 2015–16 season.
Premier League.Liverpool: Liverpool has won six UEFA Champions League titles, the most of any English club.
Premier League.Manchester City: Manchester City achieved a domestic treble in the 2018–19 season.
Premier League.Manchester United: Manchester United has won a record 20 English league titles.
Premier League.Newcastle: Newcastle United's home ground, St James' Park, has been their home since 1892.
Premier League.Nottingham Forest: Nottingham Forest won back-to-back European Cups in 1979 and 1980.
Premier League.Southampton: Southampton's nickname 'The Saints' comes from their origins as a church football team.
Premier League.Tottenham: Tottenham Hotspur was the first British club to win a European trophy, the Cup Winners' Cup in 1963.
Premier League.West Ham: West Ham United's anthem is 'I'm Forever Blowing Bubbles.'
Premier League.Wolves: Wolves were one of the founding members of the Football League in 1888.

La Liga.Alaves: Deportivo Alavés reached the UEFA Cup final in 2001.
La Liga.Athletic Club: Athletic Club only fields players native to or trained in the Basque Country.
La Liga.Atletico Madrid: Atlético Madrid's nickname is 'Los Colchoneros' due to their red and white striped jerseys.
La Liga.Barcelona: Barcelona's stadium, Camp Nou, is the largest in Europe.
La Liga.Celta Vigo: Celta Vigo's nickname is 'Os Celestes' due to their sky blue shirts.
La Liga.Getafe: Getafe CF was founded in 1983 and reached the UEFA Cup quarter-finals in 2008.
La Liga.Girona: Girona FC achieved their first promotion to La Liga in 2017.
La Liga.Las Palmas: UD Las Palmas is based in the Canary Islands.
La Liga.Leganes: CD Leganés' nickname is 'Los Pepineros' (The Cucumber Growers).
La Liga.Mallorca: RCD Mallorca won the Copa del Rey in 2003.
La Liga.Osasuna: CA Osasuna's name means 'health' in Basque.
La Liga.Rayo Vallecano: Rayo Vallecano is based in the Madrid neighborhood of Vallecas.
La Liga.Real Betis: Real Betis won the Copa del Rey in 2005 and 2022.
La Liga.Real Madrid: Real Madrid has won a record 14 UEFA Champions League titles.
La Liga.Real Sociedad: Real Sociedad won back-to-back La Liga titles in 1981 and 1982.
La Liga.Sevilla: Sevilla FC has won the UEFA Europa League a record seven times.
La Liga.Valencia: Valencia CF's stadium, Mestalla, is known for its steep stands.
La Liga.Valladolid: Real Valladolid's nickname is 'Pucela,' a reference to Joan of Arc.
La Liga.Villarreal: Villarreal CF won their first major trophy, the UEFA Europa League, in 2021.
La Liga.Espanyol: RCD Espanyol shares its city with Barcelona and was founded in 1900.

Bundesliga.Bayern München: Bayern Munich has won the most Bundesliga titles, with over 30 championships.
Bundesliga.SC Freiburg: SC Freiburg is known for its strong youth academy and sustainable practices.
Bundesliga.VfL Wolfsburg: VfL Wolfsburg won their first Bundesliga title in 2009.
Bundesliga.Werder Bremen: Werder Bremen has won the Bundesliga four times.
Bundesliga.Borussia Mönchengladbach: Mönchengladbach won five Bundesliga titles in the 1970s.
Bundesliga.FSV Mainz 05: Mainz 05's stadium is named Mewa Arena.
Bundesliga.Borussia Dortmund: Borussia Dortmund's fans are known for creating the 'Yellow Wall' at Signal Iduna Park.
Bundesliga.1899 Hoffenheim: TSG 1899 Hoffenheim quickly rose from regional leagues to the Bundesliga by 2008.
Bundesliga.Bayer Leverkusen: Bayer Leverkusen is known as 'Neverkusen' due to several runner-up finishes.
Bundesliga.Eintracht Frankfurt: Eintracht Frankfurt won the UEFA Europa League in 2022.
Bundesliga.FC Augsburg: FC Augsburg was founded in 1907 and reached the Bundesliga in 2011.
Bundesliga.VfB Stuttgart: VfB Stuttgart won the Bundesliga in 2007.
Bundesliga.RB Leipzig: RB Leipzig was founded in 2009 and reached the Bundesliga in 2016.
Bundesliga.VfL Bochum: VfL Bochum's stadium, Vonovia Ruhrstadion, has a capacity of over 27,000.
Bundesliga.1. FC Heidenheim: 1. FC Heidenheim achieved their first promotion to the Bundesliga in 2023.
Bundesliga.Union Berlin: Union Berlin achieved their first-ever promotion to the Bundesliga in 2019.
Bundesliga.FC St. Pauli: FC St. Pauli is renowned for its left-wing fan culture.
Bundesliga.Holstein Kiel: Holstein Kiel made their Bundesliga debut in the 2024–25 season.
Bundesliga.SV Elversberg: SV Elversberg earned promotion to the 2. Bundesliga for the first time in 2023 and continues to rise.

Serie A.Lazio: Lazio shares the Stadio Olimpico with rivals Roma.
Serie A.AC Milan: AC Milan has won seven European Cup/Champions League titles.
Serie A.Cagliari: Cagliari won their only Serie A title in 1970.
Serie A.Napoli: Napoli won their third Serie A title in 2023.
Serie A.Udinese: Udinese Calcio has been a consistent presence in Serie A since the 1990s.
Serie A.Genoa: Genoa CFC is Italy's oldest football club, founded in 1893.
Serie A.Juventus: Juventus has won a record 36 Serie A titles.
Serie A.AS Roma: AS Roma won the inaugural UEFA Europa Conference League in 2022.
Serie A.Atalanta: Atalanta won their first major trophy, the Coppa Italia, in 1963.
Serie A.Bologna: Bologna FC has won seven Italian league titles.
Serie A.Fiorentina: Fiorentina was the first Italian club to reach a European Cup final in 1957.
Serie A.Torino: Torino FC's 'Grande Torino' team dominated Italian football in the 1940s.
Serie A.Verona: Hellas Verona won their only Serie A title in the 1984–85 season.
Serie A.Inter: Inter Milan is the only Italian club never relegated from Serie A.
Serie A.Empoli: Empoli FC is known for developing young talents.
Serie A.Venezia: Venezia FC is known for its unique location in the canals of Venice.
Serie A.Parma: Parma won three European trophies in the 1990s.
Serie A.Lecce: US Lecce's stadium is the Stadio Via del Mare.
Serie A.Como: Como 1907 returned to Serie A in the 2024–25 season after 21 years.
Serie A.Monza: AC Monza reached Serie A for the first time in 2022.
